intro: Nauclea obtusa var. minor, commonly known as the narrow-leaved nauclea, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
